 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Sr Front-End Java Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Sr Front-End Java Software Engineer
   

  

 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 We are looking for an upbeat
 **Sr Java Front-End Software Engineer** 
 to join our team. During your journey, you will become familiar with all different essential topics related to merchant facing digital services and you will increase your knowledge to step up further and challenge yourself.
   

  

 Being part of a product team, you will transfer the product vision into design, development, and delivery, to own the backlog toward building the right product. As it is a fairly new product\service, there is room for your own interpretation and freedom to steer the content of this role, based on your experience and character.
   

  

 In this role as experienced Engineer, you are expected to be able to grasp the business problem at hand and self-organize to deliver the solution. In this team we don’t delegate features to build but rather problems to solve for our engineers.
   

  

**The team**
 You will be working in a team that today is working in an empowered way of working where we focus on Individual Contributors and involve engineers in the design process to have very good understanding of the What and Why before moving onto to How. Software engineers take on responsibility to design it, build it and ship it! Everyone in the team is value oriented and customer centric to solve real world merchant problems.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
* You develop solutions for our customers based on current Java technologies (including JavaScript).
* Examine existing code, identify flaws and build solutions to improve it.
* Cooperate optimally with your team on the active sprint to craft new software solutions.
* Support the creation of technical concepts.
* Participate with recommendations regarding knowledge, priorities, and estimates.
* Help complete full software development processes for each assigned project, adhering to company standards and expectations.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You have a professional approach, being constructive and finding solutions in the best interest of the business. You also:
   

  

* Have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another related field.
* Proven experience in Java and JavaScript.
* Previous experience working with AWS.
* Knowledge of database technologies especially SQL.
* Practical experience with version control systems like Git.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively process and structure large amounts of information.
* Are a quick learner and self-starting, showing drive and initiatives supporting business goals.
* Are a great teammate who supports his team and puts the business objectives first.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Business Developer - Data & Analys
description:
*Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ.* 




  





*Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.* 




  





 SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.
 



  





 Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.
 



  





**Din kommande roll** 




  





 Som Business Developer blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:
 


* **Analysera krav och verksamhetsprocesser** 
 med syfte att hitta bästa lösning och väg till det värde som söks
* **Driva spännande projekt** 
 från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
* **Hålla samman tvärfunktionella team** 
 i arbetet med att realisera de värdeskapande leveranser Data & Analys åtagit sig
* **Agera brygga** 
 mellan intressenter tvärs hela koncernen och alla typer av roller
* **Upptäcka och utveckla potentialen** 
 i SJs data genom moderna tekniker, metoder och arbetssätt
* **Stötta i SJs datakvalitetsarbete** 
 och på så sätt möjliggöra ytterligare utväxling och effektivisering kring data



  





 Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, men även nära Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.
 



  





**Förväntningar på den vi söker** 




  




* **En akademisk examen** 
 inom systemvetenskap, ingenjörsutbildning eller liknande tekniskt orienterad utbildning
* **Erfarenhet av att driva samverkan** 
 mellan kravställare och teknisk leverans, gärna i en analytisk och komplex kontext och antagligen i en roll som konsult
* **En analytisk och nyfiken natur** 
 , med ett stort intresse för att lösa komplexa problem och göra skillnad
* **Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter** 
 och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
* **Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder** 
 såsom SAFe och hur dessa tillämpas effektivt i en tvärfunktionell leverans
* **Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska** 
 i tal och skrift
* **Intresse och erfarenhet kring datamodellering och -kvalitetsarbete** 
 är meriterande

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Software Engineer - ZEOS Logistics (all genders)
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfilment related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The ZEOS Logistics department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfilment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in ZEOS Logistics, you will develop and operate business-critical applications for our partners and internal stakeholders that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical partner-facing backend APIs and web applications of the partner fulfilment domain. You will work with tools and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch in building high-performance, low-latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.
   

  

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion
   

  

 Our employee resource groups
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)...**
 Build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving fulfilment process relevant data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to Zalando partners in using technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Postgres, and Elasticsearch.
   

  

 Use a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
   

  

 Be part of a newly established engineering team in Stockholm and help to foster an environment of continuous learning.
   

  

**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF..** 
 .
   

  

 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in developing APIs and high-volume data streaming and processing systems with either Java or Kotlin.
   

  

 Initial hands-on experience with SQL storage technologies.
   

  

 Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch is in addition a plus.
   

  

 "You build it, you run it" approach you have had a first experience in managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support is a big plus.
   

  

 Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle. As well as, ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.
   

  

**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

**About Zalando**
 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to almost 49 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando
   

  

 Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer to Twinfinity Stockholm
Senior ServiceNow Developer
description:
*Är du en problemlösare med passion för att skapa smarta IT-lösningar och vill arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom ServiceNow? Vill du vara en del av en framåtsträvande organisation som verkar inom bank, försäkring och digitala kundkanaler? Då har vi rollen för dig!*
*Hos oss på Länsförsäkringar är vi mitt i en omfattande digital förflyttning där vi bygger framtidens IT-lösningar med ServiceNow som en central del. Vi satsar stort på att ta hem utvecklingen inom plattformen och har redan kommit en bra bit på vägen – just nu sker en konsultväxling där vi bygger upp ett starkt, internt utvecklingsteam som driver arbetet framåt. Vill du vara med? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som ServiceNow-utvecklare hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta brett över plattformen och bidra till allt från automatisering och compliance till ITSM, CMDB, GRC, SAM och SecOps. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i vår digitala transformation, där ServiceNow-plattformen är en kritisk komponent för att skapa strukturerade och effektiva IT-plattformar. Här jobbar du inte bara med IT, utan även med att förbättra verksamhetsflöden i en stor organisation som täcker både finans, försäkring och bank.
   

  

 Exempel på vad du kommer att arbeta med:
   

  

* Bygga och utveckla funktioner som automatiserar och effektiviserar verksamheten.
* Skapa integrationer mot både interna och externa system för att underlätta användarupplevelsen.
* Arbeta med allt från molnplattformar och säkerhet till onboarding-processer och digitala arbetsverktyg.
* Driva projekt där vi knyter samman olika delar av verksamheten genom moderna IT-lösningar.


 Hos oss får du möjlighet att djupdyka i ServiceNow som plattform samtidigt som du breddar din kompetens inom flera områden – en unik möjlighet!
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som drivs av att utveckla smarta lösningar som gör skillnad. Du gillar att ta dig an nya utmaningar och tycker om att se hur dina insatser bidrar till både kollegors och verksamhetens framgång.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att utveckla och konfigurera i ServiceNow-plattformen.
* Förmåga att förstå verksamhetens behov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar.


 Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Javascript, CSS, HTML, AngularJS eller integrationer som REST och SOAP.


 Det viktigaste för oss är dock att du har en nyfikenhet och ett driv att leverera funktioner som imponerar både på våra interna team och våra slutanvändare.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med den senaste tekniken – du blir en del av ett team som har en central roll i hela Länsförsäkringars digitala resa. Vårt team är experter inom olika delar av ServiceNow och vi jobbar tätt tillsammans för att skapa lösningar som underlättar vardagen för tusentals medarbetare och kunder. Vi sitter på nyckelpositioner och är uppskattade inom organisationen, där vårt arbete gör stor skillnad.
   

  

 Här får du:
   

  

* Chansen att vara en del av en organisation som jobbar inom ett brett antal områden som få andra företag berör.
* Möjlighet att utvecklas inom ServiceNow men även inom verksamhetsflöden och affärsutveckling.
* Arbeta i ett team med stort kunnande och visioner för framtiden.
* Vara med och påverka och driva projekt som har verklig betydelse.


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-10**

title: Engineering Manager - CI/CD & Developer Experience
description:
**Schibsted Marketplaces** 
 is transforming the way people consume goods and services with some of the strongest brands Like
 **FINN, Blocket, Tori, DBA & Bilbasen** 
 in the Nordics
   

  

 This Engineering Manager will be part of the Developer Success area in the Foundation Unit. The Foundation unit is designed to empower Schibsted Marketplaces providing essential Technology shared services and fostering innovation.
   

  

 Developer Success builds and evolves a comprehensive developer platform that empowers engineers across runtime, networking, observability, CI/CD, security, and developer experience. Our teams deliver composable infrastructure, developer tools, cloud governance, and FinOps solutions, all designed to enhance efficiency, scalability, and productivity.
   

  

**General Description Of The Role.**
 As the Engineering Manager for the CICD/DevEx team, you will lead a group of engineers focused on building and maintaining tools and platforms that enhance developer workflows and productivity. Your team’s mission is to ensure seamless continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) processes and provide a world-class developer experience (DevEx) through automation, self-service capabilities, and reliable tools.
   

  

 This role involves managing the team’s performance and growth, driving the execution of projects, and fostering strong cross-functional collaboration with other engineering teams and stakeholders to enable scalable and efficient development practices.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage an engineering team, providing guidance and support to ensure team members’ growth and development.
* Develop CI/CD Platforms: Oversee the development, optimization, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines to support efficient, scalable, and reliable software delivery.
* Enhance Developer Experience: Drive initiatives to simplify and enhance developer workflows, including the integration of tools like Backstage or other developer portals.
* Collaboration Across Teams: Partner with other teams and stakeholders to ensure alignment on CI/CD and DevEx goals, integrating feedback to prioritize and deliver the most impactful solutions.
* Operational Excellence: Implement best practices for system reliability, scalability, and performance in all CI/CD and DevEx tools.
* Automation & Self-Service: Lead efforts to automate processes, enabling self-service capabilities for developers to reduce friction and increase efficiency.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with the Product Manager to define priorities, ensuring the team delivers maximum value aligned with department goals.


**Qualifications & Experiences**
* Proven leadership experience, particularly in managing distributed teams across geographies.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* Good understanding of cloud infrastructure, DevOps practices, CI/CD, and platform engineering.
* Experience in managing engineers and initiatives, focusing on building high-performance teams and driving key infrastructure initiatives.
* Ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure alignment and deliverables are achieved.
* Experience with leading teams in fast-paced, evolving environments.


**Personal Attributes**
* Collaborative Leadership: A strong ability to work closely with engineers, Senior Technical Leaders, and cross-functional peers to ensure teams are aligned and successful in their deliverables.
* Mentor: An empathetic approach to team management, ensuring each team member is supported in their professional growth and development.
* Technically Proficient: Able to understand and guide the team on technical challenges, even if not directly involved in the code. You know when to leverage the expertise of the Senior Technical Leaders for deeper technical insights.
* Organizational Agility: Thrives in environments that require fast adaptation to change, maintaining a balance between technical delivery and team management.
* Problem Solver: Focused on delivering solutions by helping the team overcome technical obstacles, all while maintaining a strategic view of the department’s long-term goals.


**Recruitment Process**
* Screening with the TA Partner - 30-45 mins
* Interview with the Hiring Manager - 60 mins
* Personality & Logic Test
* Peer Interview with Engineering Manager and Product Director - 60 mins
* Interview with the Hiring Manager's Manager - 60 mins


**Sounds exciting? Let us hear from you!**
 If you are looking for a workplace and a role where you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 5th January 2025
   

  

 Please note that due to Christmas holidays we will start the process applications in early Jan 2025
   

  

*In Sweden, the offers are subjective to a successful background check*

title: Tech lead/Solution Architect
description:
**A Few Words About Us**
 First things first… What will you become a part of? Valtech, who recently acquired Kin + Carta, is the experience innovation company that exists to unlock a better way to experience the world. By blending crafts, categories, and cultures, our global team of more than 6,500 professionals in more than 60 offices help brands unlock value in a digitally accelerated world. At the intersection of insights and perspectives, we leverage the power of data, AI, creativity, and technology to achieve experience innovation for many of the world’s best-known organisations, including L’Oreal, NatWest, DWP, P&G, Volkswagen, and US department of Agriculture.
   

  

 Challenges where we re-imagine the customer journey and build new connected experiences. Challenges where we make data work in this new era and help our clients transform the way they operate and optimize business-critical digital platforms for multichannel commerce and marketing.
   

  

 From discovery to optimization, clients trust Valtech to remove complexity and deliver innovative, frictionless solutions that close the experience gap between customer expectation and reality. We are a network of more than 8,000 makers, thinkers, marketers, creatives, and developers spanning 5 continents with 60+ offices in 20+ countries.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 Valtech is looking for a Tech Lead/Solution Architect with deep experience within platform implementation such as Optimizely. Are you passionate about creating and implementing innovative digital solutions? Are you enthusiastic about delving into the evolving trends and technologies? Are you based in Stockholm with ability to come to our office 2 to 3 times a week? Then you might be the person we are looking for! Keep reading to find out.
   

  

**Technology**
 One of Valtech platforms partner is Optimizely. We have been partners since 2001 and is one of only a handful of Optimizely Global and Premium Solution Partners. You can read more about our partnership and explore some of our cases here.
   

  

**A day in the life of a Tech Lead/Solution Architect**
 As an expert, you fulfil a unique and rewarding role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a technical leader. You will shape and participate in every stage of new and ongoing client engagements, from pre-sales, discovery to delivery, collaborating within both regional project teams and our global craft circle.
   

  

 You will also actively participate in the pre-sales process, contributing to pitches and client presentations. Leveraging your technical expertise, you'll effectively communicate how the platform solutions align with client needs and objectives, ensuring a seamless transition from initial discussions to project execution.
   

  

**More Specifically, You Will**
* Engage with our clients' stakeholders from both IT and Business aligning our solutions to provide business value
* Define and implement scalable and resilient solutions for CMS projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and industry best practices
* Collaborate with and lead cross-functional teams in designing and integrating complex backend systems, including CMS, with diverse external systems and services
* Champion architectural decisions and provide mentorship to development teams, fostering a culture of innovation, quality, and collaboration
* Proactively identify performance bottlenecks and technical challenges, developing strategies to optimize application responsiveness and efficiency
* Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in the digital landscape


**You and the role**
 You are most likely someone with 10+ years of experience in backend development with a preferable focus on Optimizely CMS and it is a plus if you have experience from Commerce platforms too. You have experience handling extensive customer interaction, know how to communicate with clients, and how to identify additional ways your team can add value. You thrive in fast-paced, agile environment and are eager to contribute to a team that values innovation, creativity, and quality.
   

  

 We would love if you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Backend Developer at a Lead or Architect level
* Strong knowledge of of .NET / .NET Core framework (C#), API driven development and Privacy by Design
* Extensive experience with CMS, preferable Optimizely, including content modelling, personalization, and e-commerce integration
* Proficiency in SQL, and experience with database design and development
* Experience with cloud (Azure) and DevOps practices
* Experience in developing and implementing optimization strategies for complex digital ecosystems
* Experience in leading architectural design for enterprise projects, proficiency in enterprise architecture frameworks, and preferably relevant certifications validating professional development.


 What you can expect from us
   

  

**Link To Regional Benefits Summary Page.**
 At Valtech you’ll become part of our exceptional team of more than 8,000 talented innovators, design thinkers, marketers, creatives, and engineers. We interact across countries, disciplines, trades, roles and teams. We are consultants before anything else and take ownership of our own work, clients, and careers.
   

  

 We provide everyone with a large degree of freedom - in return, we expect an equally high degree of accountability and dedication. We transform by doing and are insanely passionate about improving the end user experience. We are a people company.
   

  

 We share our knowledge and learnings; we dare to speak up and take risks. And we care deeply about one another, our clients, and the world around us. We have from our very beginning always worked hard on providing everyone within our organization the opportunity to grow and transform their job opportunities and career paths across the world.
   

  

 From graduates to seasoned professionals who are experts in their field. Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing.
   

  

 Join Valtech
   

  

 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
   

  

**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Tech Lead/Solution Architect?**
**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Business Developer - Data & Analys till SJ
description:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ.
   

  

*Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad - både för SJ och våra kunder.*
 SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.
   

  

 Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.
   

  

**Din kommande roll**
 Som Business Developer blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:
   

  

* Analysera krav och verksamhetsprocesser med syfte att hitta bästa lösning och väg till det värde som söks
* Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
* Hålla samman tvärfunktionella team i arbetet med att realisera de värdeskapande leveranser Data & Analys åtagit sig
* Agera brygga mellan intressenter tvärs hela koncernen och alla typer av roller
* Upptäcka och utveckla potentialen i SJs data genom moderna tekniker, metoder och arbetssätt
* Stötta i SJs datakvalitetsarbete och på så sätt möjliggöra ytterligare utväxling och effektivisering kring data


 Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, men även nära Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.
   

  

**Förväntningar på den vi söker**
* En akademisk examen inom systemvetenskap, ingenjörsutbildning eller liknande tekniskt orienterad utbildning
* Erfarenhet av att driva samverkan mellan kravställare och teknisk leverans, gärna i en analytisk och komplex kontext och antagligen i en roll som konsult
* En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med ett stort intresse för att lösa komplexa problem och göra skillnad
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
* Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder såsom SAFe och hur dessa tillämpas effektivt i en tvärfunktionell leverans
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
* Intresse och erfarenhet kring datamodellering och -kvalitetsarbete är meriterande

title: Senior Build & Release Engineer - Agent Supply Chain
description:
The Datadog Agent is software that runs on customer infrastructure and supports a wide range of platforms. It collects observability data from hosts and sends them to Datadog, where our customer can analyze their monitoring and performance data. As a Senior Systems Engineer you will enable the entire Agent Organization of 100+ engineers to develop and release high quality Datadog Agent releases by improving our CI platform, tooling, processes and coding throughout.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Lead the evolutions of the Agent Supply Chain, focusing on security, reliability, and speed
* Support the growth of the Agent, welcoming new products and new engineering teams, providing the best platform to develop, test, build and release the Agent
* Participate in the release and deployment processes, finding ways to continuously improve lead times and reliability
* Drive the required changes in tooling, workflows, and culture to maximize velocity and happiness of the Agent engineers


**Who You Are:**
* A seasoned engineer with 5+ years of software development experience
* Experienced with build pipelines, CI systems, release tooling and Linux/macOS packaging
* Keen on improving developer experience
* Strong in at least one programming language and comfortable with scripting languages (python, bash)
* Someone that enjoys working with other teams across the company, putting internal and external customers’ interests first


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Benefits and Growth:**
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)
* Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions
* Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+
* Competitive global benefits


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Senior Engine Graphics Programmer
description:
Are you passionate about graphics technology and creating immersive gaming experiences? Do you have a strong C++ background and a deep understanding of 3D graphics and GPU technologies? Join our Engine & Tools team as a
 **Senior Engine Graphics Programmer** 
 , where you’ll help build and enhance the technical foundation for our games.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

**What You’ll Do...**
 As a
 **Senior Engine Graphics Programmer** 
 , you will design, implement, and maintain advanced graphical systems that bring our games to life. You’ll collaborate with game programmers, artists, and content designers to optimize their workflows and ensure high-quality visuals across platforms. You’ll also play a crucial role in mentoring junior team members, sharing your expertise, and supporting technical leadership when needed.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and optimize graphical features, shaders, and rendering backends.
* Work closely with technical leads, game developers, and artists to align engine functionality with creative goals.
* Guide and mentor other team members, share knowledge through workshops, and assist with project planning.
* Ensure systems meet performance benchmarks and run efficiently across platforms.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ Years of C++ Programming Experience, Preferably in the game industry.
* Expertise in 3D Graphics & GPU Tech with strong knowledge of rendering pipelines, HLSL, and compute shaders.
* Experience with proprietary game engines and rendering APIs like DirectX12 and Vulkan.
* Ability to diagnose and resolve complex performance issues.
* Comfortable working with multithreaded environments.
* Ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly in English.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Engine & Tools team!
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: SEB Tech Programme: DevOps Security Engineer
description:
**Är du intresserad av DevOps och IT-säkerhet? SEB erbjuder dig en bred roll med många utvecklingsmöjligheter!**
 Som DevOps Security Engineer inom Developer Experience hos SEB i Stockholm tillhör du ett specialistteam inom DevOps som tillhandahåller kritiska utvecklingsverktyg för alla utvecklingsteam på SEB. Detta är en unik möjlighet för dig som är ny i karriären och vill utvecklas inom både DevOps och IT-säkerhet!
   

  

 Parallellt med rollen som DevOps Security Engineer deltar du även i vårt talangprogram SEB Tech Programme, som ger dig en bred inblick i en stor och komplex, internationell organisation via fördjupat lärande och nätverkande. Med andra ord får du en unik möjlighet att utvecklas inom IT i en modern organisation med hög förändringstakt!
   

  

**Din framtida roll och ditt team**
 I rollen som DevOps Security Engineer tillhör du ett kompetent plattformsteam som tillhandahåller viktiga funktioner till bankens utvecklare, exempelvis GitHub, Artifactory och Azure DevOps. Vi arbetar med att utveckla, förvalta och supportera kring våra tjänster. Tekniskt arbetar vi med Linux, Windows, Kubernetes, storskalig infrastruktur, programmering/skriptning ( t.ex . Python) och kodanalys.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med alla aspekter av området med extra fokus på IT-säkerhet. Detta innefattar bland annat att stödja våra användare med verktyg för kodanalys och bidra med "security best practices". Det här är ett område i förändring med många spännande initiativ för att modernisera och effektivisera vårt arbete. Fokus framåt ligger på IT-säkerhet, automatisering och molnlösningar.
   

  

**Din framtida chef, Joachim Bergström, beskriver arbetet på Developer Experience så här:**
*”Som DevOps Security Engineer har du en viktig roll som spänner över områden som DevOps, utveckling och infrastruktur. Vi delar med oss av vår erfarenhet till dig och ser fram emot att få ta del utav din kunskap.”*
**Dina kvalifikationer**
 Har du passion för IT och är nyfiken på SEB? SEB Tech Programme ger dig en kickstart i din utveckling och karriär! Som person är du kommunikativ och trivs i en roll med många kontaktytor där du dagligen interagerar med dina kollegor inom avdelningen. Du som önskar en bred och varierande roll kommer trivas bra hos oss!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har en akademisk examen IT eller teknik alternativt 2-årig YH-examen inom relevant område
* Tar examen innan programmets start eller har tagit examen inom de senaste två åren
* Är flytande i engelska, i tal och skrift
* Har kunskaper inom skriptspråk som exempelvis Python, Ansible, Terraform, Bash och PowerShell eller liknande
* Det är meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT eller teknik alternativt bank eller försäkring


**Vårt erbjudande till dig**
 I över ett decennium har vi genom SEB Tech Programme erbjudit talanger som är i början av sin IT-karriär att utvecklas till vassa IT-specialister. Idag är SEB en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare inom IT, vilket ger dig goda och spännande möjligheter att förverkliga dina ambitioner.
   

  

 SEB erbjuder dig:
   

  

* Ett sex månader långt talangprogram inom IT, anpassat för professionell och personlig utveckling.
* Spännande affärsutmaningar och ett case-projekt där du kan skapa värde och skillnad för SEB:s affär och organisation.
* Möjligheten att skapa relationer och nätverk inom banken.
* Efter programmets slut är målet att erbjuda dig en anställning i den roll du har blivit antagen till.


**Vill du bli en del av SEB?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SEB med Ada Digital, som sköter hela rekryteringsprocessen på ett fördomsfritt och kompetensbaserat sätt. Du söker enkelt via ansökningsformuläret
 **här** 
 med ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil, och alltid utan personligt brev. Notera dock att vi inte kan ta emot några ansökningar via email.
   

  

 Sök jobbet snarast om du är intresserad, men allra senast den 5:e januari! Om du har frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Sofie Nordvall på sofie.nordvall@adadigital.se .
   

  

**Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här: www.sebgroup.com/career**
 Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.
   

  

 Läs också gärna mer om SEB Tech Programmes upplägg och de andra lediga positionerna till starten 2025 här: https://sebgroup.com/sv/karriar/vem-ar-du/nyexaminerade-och-studenter/tech-program

title: Atlassian System Engineer, Internal Operations
description:
Are you an Atlassian-savvy problem-solver with a passion for optimizing development environments and collaboration tools? Do you want to use your expertise to make a real difference in society through technology? We are looking for a creative and highly skilled Atlassian System Engineer to strengthen our team and enable our development teams to work smarter, faster, and more securely.
  
  

Sectra is one of the world’s leading providers of IT systems for managing medical images. Our long-term ambition is to be the leader in making customers’ diagnostics more efficient and contribute to proven improved care outcomes for patients. In other words - we create future-proof and effective solutions that help save lives.
  
  

Working as an Atlassian System Engineer in Internal Operations
  
  

You will be part of a team focused on internal engineering and efficiency, paving the way for the rest of the development organization. The team’s responsibilities include CI/CD environments, automation, tools, security, and system administration. Our current Atlassian suite includes both Atlassian Data Center and Cloud products, such as Jira, Jira Service Management and Confluence.
  
  

**Your main responsibilities will most likely include:**  

Administering and optimizing our Atlassian products—managing configurations, upgrades, and user provisioning across Data Center and Cloud.
  
Automating administrative tasks and workflows through scripting or tools (e.g., Bash, Python, Ansible).
  
Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks, while ensuring security and compliance.
  
Collaborating with stakeholders to align Atlassian solutions with evolving business needs.
  
Continuously improving processes and environments—there’s always room for innovation!
  
Work with great people
  
SOFIA ADOLFSSON
  
UX Designer
  
"There is no sense of prestige at Sectra, no hierarchy. Everyone is listened to regardless of their position."
  
ADAM ALSEGÅRD
  
Software Engineer
  
"I believe Sectra is a great company, with the possibility for personal growth."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

At Sectra, we hire for attitude and ability – train for skill. This means who you are is more important than your previous experiences. There are a few core abilities that are central for any role. We always look for your willingness and ability to learn and take on new tasks fast, utilize previous experiences and quickly grasp new information. We also want you to have a strong analytical mindset in which we consider it to be important that you can understand and break down and solve problems. We also look for good communicators who have the ability to interact with colleagues, partners and customers in an effective, clear and constructive way.
  
  

**In addition to these abilities, we also want you to:**  

A few years of professional experience with Atlassian tools—preferably in both Data Center and Cloud environments.
  
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering, IT, or a similar field, with a strong academic record.
  
Experience with system administration (Linux/Windows), automation/scripting, and basic networking concepts.
  
Familiarity with authentication methods (LDAP, SAML, or OAuth) and security best practices.
  
Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
  
  

**We consider it a great asset if you:**  

Have experience in software development using agile methods.
  
Know additional programming or scripting languages.
  
Speak more languages than those required above.
  
Pursue passions outside of work, whether in sports, music, the arts, or unique hobbies.
  
  

**Other information:**  

The goal is for the right candidate to start as soon as possible.
  
  

We recruit on an ongoing basis. This means we encourage you to apply or contact us as soon as possible.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Making a difference
  
  

Great colleagues
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Innovation & technology
  
  

Global environment
  
  

Working close to customers
  
  

About the company
  
  

Sectra develops and sells cutting-edge solutions for medical IT and cybersecurity. We help hospitals and those who are training future healthcare personnel to improve their efficiency so that patients can receive better care. We also support and help defense, authorities, and critical social functions to secure their communication against eavesdropping and protect their systems against unauthorized access. This is how we create conditions for a healthier and safer society.
  
  

One thing that identifies us at Sectra is our customer obsession— our ability and willingness to understand, create value for and stand up for our customers. This shared priority is at the core of our culture. Our customers describe this as having the knowledge to meet expectations, the passion to exceed them. As we hire for attitude and ability - train for skill, we happily expand your knowledge, if you bring the passion and willingness to learn.
  
  

Stefan Doverud | Contact Person
company_description: The company was founded in 1978, has its head office in Linköping with subsidiaries in 19 countries and operates through partners worldwide.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer
  
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
  
We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.
  
  

Please be aware that a valid work permit is a mandatory requirement to be considered for the role.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
  
Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
  
Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
  
Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
  
Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Expert level UX and UI design skills
  
Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
  
Highly proficient in Figma
  
Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
  
You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
  
Genuine passion for great UX
  
Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
  
Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
  
Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender
  
  

**Benefits:**  

International work environment
  
Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
  
Five weeks of holiday per year
  
Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
  
Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
  
Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: QA Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
  
We are looking for a highly skilled QA Engineer for our team in Stockholm, Sweden.
  
  

Please be aware that a valid work permit is a mandatory requirement to be considered for the role.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Preparing test scenarios, test plans, test procedures, and test reports for various projects (e.g. Design Center/InnerSpace, Accounts or Community)
  
Manual testing as well as automation testing for both UX/UI and functionality of the developed software/application to make sure requirements are met or exceeded
  
Collaborating with a team consisting of PM, developers and designers
  
  

**Requirements:**  

At least 5 years of experience in a QA role
  
Thorough understanding of QA methodology and best practices
  
Hands-on experience in writing and executing test cases and test plans
  
Experience with web test automation
  
Experienced in scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript / TypeScript)
  
Experience with Continuous Integration tools (e.g. Jenkins/AWS Code Pipeline)
  
Passionate about ensuring great UX for the customers/users of the product you work on
  
Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)
  
  

**Benefits:**  

International work environment
  
Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
  
Five weeks of holiday per year
  
Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
  
Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
  
Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Teknisk Projektledare
description:
**Teknisk projektledare**

UNICEF Sverige söker nu en påläst och förtroendeskapande Teknisk Projektledare, som kan ta ansvar för den tekniska utvecklingen och förvaltningen av vår webbplats. Du kommer även att driva utvecklingsprojekt av vår CRM-plattform och integrationer mellan webbplatsen och CRM-plattformen.


**Om oss**


UNICEF, FN:s barnfond, arbetar för att göra barnkonventionen till verklighet för alla barn. Som en av världens ledande barnrättsorganisationer levererar UNICEF i samarbete med partners mer rent vatten, livräddande mat och näring, vaccin, utbildning och skydd från våld än någon annan humanitär organisation. På mandat från FN arbetar UNICEF i 190 länder både i katastrofer och långsiktigt för att säkra barns rättigheter och bygga en bättre framtid.


UNICEF Sverige är en av 33 nationalkommittéer till UNICEF. Vi arbetar med att påverka beslutsfattare och makthavare, sprida kunskap och utbilda samt samla in pengar, för en varaktig förändring och hållbar utveckling för barn - i Sverige och globalt. Vi arbetar i partnerskap med regeringen, regioner och kommuner, myndigheter, näringsliv och civilsamhället. Genom att samverka, påverka och mobilisera resurser skapar vi resultat för och tillsammans med barn och unga.

**Om tjänsten**


Som Teknisk projektledare driver du primärt utvecklingsprojekt för vår webbplats, unicef.se, samt vår CRM-plattform, Salesforce och relaterade system eller tjänster. Du ansvarar för planering, budget och genomförande av utvecklingsprojekten och ser till att olika intressenter i organisationen är uppdaterade och involverade i projekten. Arbetet inkluderar även kravställning, testhantering och projektadministration.


Du agerar produktägare för det löpande utvecklingsarbetet av vår webbplats. Tillsammans med kommersiella intressenter i organisationen prioriterar du löpande UX- och designjusteringar och teknisk utveckling av tjänster och funktioner i syfte att nå våra mål eller öka konverteringen på webbplatsen.


Du kommer att arbeta med stora delar av organisationen samt våra olika leverantörer för teknisk utveckling och UX- och design. Du tillhör avdelningen DIT (Digtial, Innovation & Tech) och rapporterar till CDO/Chef DIT.


**Om dig**


* Du har arbetat som projektledare, produktägare, systemägare eller techlead.
* Du har mycket god erfarenhet av att driva utvecklingsprojekt (från kravinsamling till färdig produkt).
* Du har mycket god erfarenhet av arbete med UX- och design för webb.
* Stor förståelse kring agila arbetsmetoder, samt erfarenhet av traditionella projektmodeller
* Du är påläst och har ett brinnande intresse för den senaste tekniken.
* Erfarenhet av e-handel inom B2C är meriterande.
* Mycket god förståelse och insikt kring arbete med moderna webbplattformar och kringliggande ekosystem
* Du är strukturerad och organiserad, men klarar samtidigt av många och snabba förändringar.
* Du bemästrar både svenska och engelska i skrift och tal.

Vi söker dig som är professionell, förtroendeskapande och en stark kommunikatör. Du ser till affärsvärde och kan prioritera och balansera önskemål från olika intressenter, är nyfiken avseende ny teknik och snabb på att lära dig nytt. Du är självgående och har förmåga att röra dig mellan helhet och detalj. Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet i en liknande roll.


**Anställning och Ansökan**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, gärna med start så snart som möjligt. Vi tillämpar 6 mån provanställning.


Sök redan idag! Vi tillämpar löpande urvalsarbete och uppmanar dig att skicka in din ansökan snarast via vårt rekryteringssystem (EJ via epost), dock senast den 23 jan 2025. Om du har frågor om tjänsten får du gärna kontakta vår CDO/Chef DIT Daniel Larsson på daniel.larsson@unicef.se.


Varmt välkommen att söka!


*För UNICEF Sverige är mångfald en självklarhet och ett naturligt inslag i verksamheten. Medarbetare med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter skapar ökad kreativitet och kvalitet i organisationen. Därför beaktas alltid mångfaldhetsaspekten vid urval till nya rekryteringar.*

*UNICEF Sverige arbetar med aktivt medarbetarskap. Det går ut på att skapa en organisation och en företagskultur där medarbetarna kan ta initiativ och agera på ett självständigt sä*tt. *Vårt ledarskap är värderingsbaserat med ett coachande förhållningssätt, vilket lägger grunden för ett starkt engagemang, som i sin tur leder till ett bättre resultat. Våra medarbetare efterfrågar ett högre syfte och mening med sitt arbete och vill att det stämmer överens med deras egna värderingar.*

*Hos oss är organisationskulturen mycket viktig och vi arbetar därför aktivt med den.* *UNICEF Sverige har enats kring tre värdeord som ska prägla samspelet mellan medarbetare, chefer och externa kontakter; professionalism, mod och handlingskraft.*
