title: LIA-Internship- Marketing
description:
**Internship in Marketing at FlatFrog** 

Are you a passionate and driven marketing or design student looking for an exciting LIA placement or internship? Do you want the opportunity to work with an innovative and global player that is revolutionizing the way we collaborate and communicate?

FlatFrog is now looking for a committed intern who wants to be part of our marketing team!

**About FlatFrog**  
FlatFrog is a leading innovator in interactive display solutions and we focus on creating technologies that strengthen collaboration in meeting rooms around the world. With customers among the world's largest brands, we are a global player that is passionate about creating the workplace of the future.

**What we offer you**  
During your internship with us, you will have the opportunity to:

* Create engaging content: Plan, produce and publish content for FlatFrog's digital channels.
* Work with campaigns: Participate in the planning and implementation of marketing campaigns to increase our visibility and reach more customers.
* Analyze and optimize: Work with our website and analysis tools to evaluate and optimize our marketing efforts.
* Contribute creative ideas: Participate in workshops and brainstorming to create new strategies and campaigns.

We offer a creative environment where you have the chance to develop your skills and build a strong CV.

**Who are you?**  
To thrive with us, we see that you:

* Study marketing, communication, media, design, UI/UX or similar.
* Have great curiosity and a genuine interest in digital marketing.
* Are creative and have an eye for detail.
* Have good knowledge of English, both spoken and written.
* Experience with design and tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Canva and Hubspot.
* Are a “doer” and like to take your own initiatives.

**Scope of the internship** 

* Period: By agreement, at least 12 weeks, ideally January-June.
* Scope: Full-time or at least 20 hours per week
* Location: Our head office in Lund, with some possibility of remote work.

**Application**  
Does this sound like something for you?  
Send your CV and a short introduction about yourself and why you want to intern at FlatFrog.  
We are recruiting continuously so don't wait to submit your application!

Welcome to become a part of FlatFrog and help us create the workplace of the future!

Job Type: Internship

Work Location: In person

title: UX/UI designer
description:
Har du en passion för att skapa användarvänliga digitala lösningar? Vill du arbeta i en kreativ och utvecklande roll som UX/UI-designer i ett unikt bolag inom försäkring där du kommer att spela en viktig roll i den digitala försäljningen och marknadsföringen? Då har vi på Svedea rätt utmaning för dig!


**Om tjänsten**  

Som UX/UI-designer kommer du att ha en central roll i att förbättra och vidareutveckla vår webb. Du kommer att arbeta både med användarupplevelsen och gränssnittsdesignen, i nära samarbete med vår andra UX/UI-designer och andra nyckelpersoner inom organisationen. Genom att kombinera din kreativitet och tekniska kompetens kommer du att spela en central roll i att visualisera och implementera designlösningar som skapar en intuitiv och engagerad upplevelse för våra kunder.


I rollen kommer du att:


* arbeta med gränssnittsdesign genom hela kundresan på webben
* kontinuerligt förbättra och underhålla designsystemet
* skapa prototyper och mock-ups för att visualisera olika delar av processen
* ha ett nära samarbete med det agila utvecklingsteamet, särskilt Front-end-utvecklarna, för att säkerställa att designen implementeras korrekt
* samarbeta i arbetet med användningsstudier (UX-research)


Du kommer att tillhöra vårt team Digital. Vi är ett härligt och glatt gäng på 7 personer, alla med olika expertiser men med ett gemensamt fokus på digital försäljning. Lär känna dina framtida kollegor – klicka här!

**Din bakgrund**  

På Svedea lägger vi stor vikt vid personlighet och potential. Vi söker dig som är kreativ med ett öga för detaljer, färg och form. Med ett högt eget driv och initiativförmåga tar du ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och slutför det som påbörjats. Du tycker om att samarbeta med andra och har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Vidare är det viktigt att du kan ge och ta emot feedback med en strävan efter att utveckla dig själv och dina kollegor. Som person är du öppensinnad och nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker. Med en prestigelös attityd vågar du utmana och kommer med egna förslag och idéer på förbättringar. Din analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att tolka användardata för att förbättra den digitala användarupplevelsen.


Utöver din personlighet är det viktigt att du har:


* relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom UX eller motsvarande
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av användargränssnittsdesign och verktyg som Sketch eller Figma
* förståelse för användningsstudier (UX-research)
* mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska då det är vårt bolagsspråk


Det är meriterande om du har:

* erfarenhet av att arbeta med användningsstudier (UX-research)
* kunskap om och erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* grundläggande förståelse för HTML och CSS
* erfarenhet av att skapa och underhålla designsystem
* erfarenhet av att samarbeta med flera intressenter för att skapa användarcentrerad design

**Vi erbjuder dig**

  

* En arbetsplats som befinner sig i en spännande expansiv fas där dina tankar och idéer uppmuntras.
* En inspirerade företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerande kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Mer om vår kultur hittar du här!
* Bra förmåner och 5 000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag. Här kan du läsa mer om våra förmåner!
* Möjlighet till visst distansarbete för att kunna balansera privat- och arbetsliv.
* Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour nedan

**Låter det intressant?**  

Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag vilket är den 31 januari. Observera att vi enbart tar emot ansökningar via länken i annonsen. Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Caroline Sundvik, Chef Digital mejl: Caroline.Sundvik@svedea.se eller telefon: 072-141 14 94. Har du frågor kring processen, vänligen kontakta HR Helena Andersson, mejl: Helena.Andersson@svedea.se eller telefon: 073-598 51 93.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


*Tester och arbetsprov kan förekomma i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.*  

  



**Om Svedea**  

Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 15 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 400 000 kunder och fortsätter att växa snabbt.


Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen och vi strävar efter att våra kunder ska tycka att försäkring är enkelt. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs på jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna. Vår resa har bara börjat!

*Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkringar 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023.*

title: UX Designer
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 We’re on the lookout for a UX Designer with a strong passion for accessibility and design systems to join us. In this role, you’ll create intuitive, user-focused interfaces for software, allowing individuals with communication challenges to express themselves using innovative eye-tracking technology.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
**Champion System Thinking:** 
 Craft scalable, reusable solutions that seamlessly align across platforms and products.
   

  

**Develop and Document Design Standards:** 
 Establish design principles, components, interaction patterns, and design tokens rooted in accessibility guidelines to promote consistency across our software suite.
   

  

**Ensure Seamless Collaboration:** 
 Prepare comprehensive design documentation for smooth handovers to our development teams.
   

  

**Collaborate Cross-Functionally:** 
 Work closely with product managers, developers, speech therapists, and fellow designers to create user-centric solutions that are aligned with our goals.
   

  

 We have a hybrid model so you will be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and from the comfort of your own home.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For:**
* Proven UX Experience: A solid background in UX design with a portfolio that showcases your ability to deliver impactful projects. (If you don’t have a portfolio, tell us why – we’re interested in your story!)
* Design Systems Expertise: Demonstrated experience in building or maintaining a design system for multi-component, multi-platform products.
* Proficiency with Design Tools: High-level skills in Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar software (We are using Figma!)
* Excellent Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.


**Bonus Points For:**
* Accessibility Expertise: A strong understanding of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and experience designing for users with diverse physical or cognitive abilities.


**Next step!**
 Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Product Designer - Team Book
description:
If you are passionate about the hospitality industry and excited to reshape the digital customer journey experience, then this is the perfect opportunity for you! We are on the lookout for a creative and driven
 **Product Designer** 
 to join our team Book and take our guest obsession to the next level.
   

  

 At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation, technology, and a deep commitment to our guests. We find ourselves at an exhilarating juncture in our journey. Our ambition? To position Strawberry as the catalyst for a unique opportunity to explore and revolutionize the hospitality industry.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Product Designer, your primary goal is to craft the best booking experience for our guests at Strawberry web and app! At Strawberry, we are constantly striving to enhance every step of our guests' journey. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and user needs.
   

  

 As part of the design team, you will manage the entire design process, from initial exploration to user research, concept development, user testing, and delivering high-end UI design ready for implementation by developers. Adapting the design process to meet stakeholder needs and project timelines is crucial. You'll employ a user-centered approach, creating prototypes and wireframes, iterating design solutions rapidly, and conducting usability testing to ensure the best outcomes.
   

  

**Who We Think You Are**
 We believe you have at least 3 years of experience in UX and UI design, with a solid understanding of various design methodologies and the wisdom to know when to use which. You should be experienced in conducting research and testing, producing UI, and collaborating closely with product owners, other designers, and developers throughout the development process. You have hands-on experience with digital accessibility. Proficiency in Figma and maintaining a design system is essential.
   

  

 You likely hold a degree in UX, interactive design, or a related field and have thrived in a fast-paced business environment where taking initiative is key. As a great team player, you enjoy inspiring and having fun with your colleagues. Strong communication skills are vital for collaborating with stakeholders in a rapidly changing environment.
   

  

 Detail-oriented and a critical thinker, you approach problems with a positive, can-do attitude. You have a knack for problem-solving and logical thinking, always keeping an eye on the next innovation and the latest trends.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
* The chance to be part of a passionate team with exceptional colleagues and an inclusive culture, that believes every stay should be a story worth telling.
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.


 Sounds interesting?
   

  

 Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!
   

  

 Please note that we currently have two open design roles: one focused on our internal tool, Strawberry Porta
 **l** 
 , and another for our guest-facing digital products. If you're interested in both roles, please submit only one application and clearly indicate your interest in both positions.
   

  

 We are primarily looking for candidates residing in Sweden, ideally in the Stockholm area.
   

  

 Note that applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: Grafisk Designer
company_industry: Environmental Services, Engineering Services, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
*Brinner du för en hållbar framtid? Kom och jobba på ett ledande globalt miljöteknikföretag* 




  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Vi söker en passionerad grafisk designer för att stötta upp vårt grafiska designteam. Mellifiq producerar kontinuerligt stora mängder innehåll (content) som ett resultat av all den research, laboratorietestning, och komplexa lösningar vi erbjuder våra kunder. Det innehåll vi producerar används i kommunikations-, marknadsförings- och utbildningssyfte för både kunder, leverantörer och anställda runt om i världen. Vi producerar majoriteten av all grafisk design in-house.
 



  





 Tjänsten är placerad i Hägersten, Stockholm.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi tror att du är en kreativ grafisk designer som har ett genuint intresse för kommunikation och hur budskap kan förstärkas med hjälp av grafisk form. Du har en förmåga att visualisera dina idéer. Vi är en digital organisation och du behöver besitta ett tekniskt intresse och kunskaper i hur du arbetar i digitala verktyg. Vi tror på lärande under tiden du arbetar och på personlig utveckling på jobbet, det finns goda möjligheter att växa både i din egen kunskap och din position i företaget
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk design eller annat relevant område
* Goda kunskaper i Adobe sviten såsom Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, After Effects etc.
* Förståelse för UX design, responsive interface, typografi, färg och form samt grunderna i SEO och SEM
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift
* Körkort



  





**Meriter** 



* Erfarenhet av att jobba i WordPress & Microsoft Office
* Erfarenhet inom rörlig grafik, foto, film, video, animering och illustration
* Erfarenhet av marknadsföring inom sociala medier & visuella identiteter



  





 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
 



 Startdatum: Omgående, enligt överenskommelse
 



 Arbetstid: Heltid
 



  





 Vi läser ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

title: Product Designer - CRM and Customer Engagement
description:
**Position: Product Designer - CRM and Customer Engagement** 




**Location:** 
  London / Stockholm
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a talented Product Designer with a focus on CRM and customer engagement to join our growing solutions team. This individual will be responsible for designing consumer-centric journeys and scalable design systems across digital touchpoints, including email, in-app, and web communication. The ideal candidate will thrive in Figma, translating complex ideas into seamless, intuitive experiences that drive engagement and retention.
 



  





**Responsibilities 🧑‍💻** 




**Journey design:** 



* Design and prototype end-to-end user journeys across CRM channels such as email, rich push notifications, in-app messages, and web messaging.
* Map and optimise customer touchpoints to enhance the user experience and drive measurable engagement outcomes.
* Collaborate with CRM strategists, marketers, and developers to implement user-centered design principles across all engagement initiatives.



**Design systems:** 



* Develop and maintain scalable design systems that ensure consistency across multiple channels and platforms.
* Build reusable Figma component libraries for rapid design and iteration across different communication channels.
* Ensure all designs are responsive, accessible, and aligned with brand guidelines.



**Collaboration:** 



* Work closely with the Tech Specialist, CRM teams, and external partners to design for personalisation and data-driven experiences.
* Partner with developers to ensure accurate implementation of design specs and interactions.
* Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve overall team output.
* Present and align with various stakeholders across the clients' business.



**Operational delivery:** 



* Lead the design execution of CRM campaigns and automations, delivering high-quality design assets that meet project deadlines.
* Prototype interactive elements and micro-interactions to enhance communication effectiveness.
* Analyse A/B testing with the execution team to inform design decisions and optimise engagement.



**Innovation and trends:** 



* Stay current with design and technology trends within CRM and digital engagement.
* Experiment with emerging technologies and design approaches to drive innovation in customer communication.
* Advocate for design thinking and customer-centricity within the organisation.



**Agency life:** 



* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain design decisions to non-design stakeholders.
* Ability to present information to clients in a visually engaging and easy-to-understand way, ensuring clarity and simplicity in complex design concepts.



  





**Qualifications 🧑‍🏫** 



* Proven experience (3-5 years) as a Product Designer, UX/UI Designer, or similar role, with a focus on CRM, lifecycle marketing, or customer engagement.



 Experience working within a consultancy or agency environment, managing multiple clients and projects.
 


* Strong proficiency in Figma, including creating component libraries and prototyping.
* A solid understanding of designing for email, push notifications, and in-app/web experiences.
* Experience working with customer data, personalisation, and dynamic content in design workflows.
* Strong portfolio showcasing CRM or engagement design work.
* Understanding of Email specific design considerations such as dark mode optimisation, accessibility and functionality/compatibility constraints.



  





**Nice to have ❤️** 



* Experience designing for fintech, SaaS, or subscription-based products.
* Familiarity with Braze, Iterable, or similar customer engagement platforms.
* Experience with Stripo or similar no-code editors.



  





 Looking forward hearing from you!

title: UX Designer sökes
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker efter fler seniora UX-designers med hjärtat på rätt ställe och som vill vara med oss på resan att designa för en bättre framtid.
   

  

 Rollen:
   

  

 Kravet är att du har mellan 6-10 års erfarenhet som UX-designer med flertalet framgångsrika projekt bakom dig där du jobbat hands-on med UX och levererat lösningar utifrån användarnas faktiska behov. Du behärskar hela processen. Du har bra koll på tillgänglighet och har levererat lösningar som är tillgänglighetsanpassade och du får gärna ha en eller flera certifieringar inom Tillgänglighetsområdet.
   

  

 Om oss:
   

  

 Vi är ett nystartat gäng, erfarna och ödmjuka människor som jobbar med en variation av kunder och strävar efter att bli ett av de ledande bolagen i Stockholm inom området.
   

  

 Var du får hos oss:
   

  

 Spännande uppdrag som varierar över tid och du är alltid med och bestämmer ditt nästa uppdrag. Du kommer vara en viktig del hos oss i resan mot att bli ett ledande konsultbolag i Stockholm. Vi kommer bland annat ge dig utmaningar och en individuell utvecklingsplan för din karriär, kollektivavtal och en konkurrenskraftig lön.
   

  

 Skall Krav:
   

  

* Du har svenska som förstaspråk, flytande i engelska.
* Du har högskoleexamen inom området.
* Du har minst 6 års arbetserfarenhet inom området.
* Du bor i Stockholm eller i närheten av huvudstaden.
* Du har jobbat med kunder inom tex. bank, försäkring, retail, produktbolag.
* Du har koll på hela UX-processen.
* Du har en stor verktygslåda och kan facilitera workshops.
* Du är duktig på att sammanfatta och dokumentera insikter på ett enkelt sätt.
* Du kan jobba med olika prototypverktyg och kan anpassa dig efter kundens önskemål, tex. Figma.
* Du har goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av att arbeta med digital tillgänglighet.
* Du har koll på det nya direktivet som kommer 2025.
* Du har erfarenhet av att ta fram visioner och roadmaps.
* Du är en naturlig lagspelare som gillar att få andra att glänsa.


 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälsar
   

  

 Aki Ravelin, Business Unit Manager
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande, ansök därför redan idag genom att klicka på ansök på https://www.qrios.se .
   

  

**Fakta**
* Bransch


 IT
   

  

* Stad Stockholm
* Anställningsform Tillsvidareanställning
* Uppdragstyp Heltid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-01-31
* Referensnummer 1080


**Har du frågor?**
 Aki Ravelin
   

  

 +46 70 376 32 81
   

  

 aki.ravelin@qrios.se

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
*We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Whaaat? That’s right. We’ll get back to that. Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask. Well, a third of our employees are actually working on developing products and solutions that can help you use energy in a smarter way and at a lower cost – all with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.*
*Our growth rate has been truly amazing, and still, we’re just getting started. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 .
   

  

**🚀🚀Job Mission**
 Join Tibber at an exciting time of growth and opportunity! As a Senior Product Designer, you’ll take on a wide range of design challenges throughout the product lifecycle, collaborating closely with engineering, product, product specialists, and fellow product designers.
   

  

**Some Of Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
**Design system expertise.** 
 You’ll play a vital role in driving, contributing to, building, maintaining, and evolving our design systems. You’ll engage stakeholders and advocate for consistency through the design system.
   

  

**User advocacy.** 
 You’ll champion the user perspective in design discussions, ensuring usability and accessibility standards are met across all products and platforms.
   

  

**Collaboration.** 
 Working within a cross-functional team, you’ll research, wireframe, design, and test to deliver high-quality solutions for your team’s domain.
   

  

**User research.** 
 You’ll identify when user research is needed and, in collaboration with user researchers, plan, conduct, and synthesize research and usability test findings.
   

  

**Two-way feedback culture.** 
 You’ll regularly share your designs and seek feedback, approaching and resolving design critiques constructively and gracefully.
   

  

**UI Design.** 
 You’ll engage in hands-on crafting of implementation-ready designs, focusing on details such as interaction and UI design choices.
   

  

**⚡⚡️Ideal Profile**
**UX Design expertise.** 
 You have 5+ years of experience in UX design, with a strong portfolio showcasing your design process, including wireframes, prototypes, and final designs.
   

  

**Solid understanding of product development principles.** 
 You’re familiar with principles such as viability, desirability, and feasibility, as well as interaction design principles like consistency, affordance, learnability, predictability, and feedback, and how these integrate into the design process.
   

  

**User research skills.** 
 You bring strong experience with user research methods, including interviews, surveys, usability testing, and data analysis.
   

  

**Engineering collaborator.** 
 You excel in partnering with engineers to implement designs and work as a cohesive team.
   

  

**User problem-solving expertise.** 
 You invest time in understanding core user problems, recognizing that defining the “what” is essential to designing the “how.”
   

  

**Excellent communication.** 
 You effectively articulate design decisions with your team and stakeholders, advocating for the user while fostering collaboration.
   

  

**Team player.** 
 You value teamwork and enjoy the process of co-creating solutions with your team.
   

  

**Technical proficiency.** 
 You’re highly skilled in Figma, particularly in working with components and variants in a design system.
   

  

**Agility in work.** 
 You’re experienced in running cross-functional workshops, design sprints, and collaborative exercises.
   

  

**Leadership mindset.** 
 Experience mentoring or guiding other designers is a plus. You consistently raise the bar, taking ownership of the quality of your work while driving quality across the team.
   

  

**🦹🏽‍♀️👨‍🎤Get Ready For**
**Innovation.** 
 A way to change the landscape of one of the most important industries on the planet.
   

  

**Growth.** 
 A possibility to learn a lot and push the barriers of what you think is possible, with the possibility to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Autonomy.** 
 An autonomous and humble culture in a scale-up adventure.
   

  

**Empowerment.** 
 Your voice matters, we are a place to work where laughter and support amongst diverse and inclusive colleagues are guaranteed.
   

  

**Flexible benefits.** 
 Whether this is towards, health, wellness, equipment, or other allowances important to you, we will do our best to accommodate your needs.
   

  

**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset**
 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. Tibber is a startup in the word's true sense, which means we are on a journey of constant change. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users.
   

  

 We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 We're very proud of being a mission-driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki, and with that number growing each week, we’re still just getting started. Throughout 2025 we will continue to grow in our current markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Volunteer UI/UX Designer to Help Smallholder Farmers Create Inclusive Agri Ecosystem with eKutir
description:
**This is an opportunity to work with an Ashoka Fellow**
 Ashoka Fellows are leading social entrepreneurs that have been taken through a rigorous selection process, testing the quality of their ideas and character, to become part of the Ashoka Fellowship and Network. Ashoka Fellows take on the challenges of building innovative system change ideas to make and spread social impact in a world wrought with challenges. They refuse to let the ‘impossible’ stand in their way to creating a better world.
   

  

**This is an unpaid, volunteer opportunity**
**About The Affiliated Organization**
 eKutir is a social enterprise specializing in data-driven solutions, AgTech innovations, and digital platforms designed to improve productivity, sustainability, and profitability within the Agri-Food sector. Its flagship platforms, ALLIN AgTech and METSA, offer a comprehensive approach to agricultural and food ecosystem challenges by providing actionable insights, facilitating ecosystem integration, and addressing climate change. It was established to help the small and marginal farmers as well as other public and private stakeholders in the agri food ecosystem to go for an inclusive and impactful market system.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.ekutirsb.com
   

  

**Job Description**
 This volunteer project involves enhancing the user interface and user experience of eKutir’s digital platforms, including the ALLIN Platform System and other associated tools. These platforms serve as a bridge between farmers, agricultural stakeholders, and technology-driven solutions to improve productivity, sustainability, and livelihoods. The primary goal is to create intuitive, accessible, and user-friendly designs that empower farmers and stakeholders to interact seamlessly with the platform. This will help ensure that the technology effectively addresses their needs, improves decision-making, and drives greater adoption. As our design volunteer you will:
   

  

* Collaborate with the eKutir team to understand user needs, challenges, and workflows.
* Design wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for platform features and interfaces.
* Conduct user research and testing to refine designs and ensure usability.
* Work on improving the platform’s visual aesthetics and overall user experience.
* Provide recommendations to align design solutions with eKutir’s mission and goals.


 Your work will directly impact the lives of smallholder farmers by enabling them to access actionable insights, improve productivity, and enhance their livelihoods. A well-designed platform will foster trust, transparency, and greater engagement among users, ensuring that eKutir's innovative solutions reach and benefit those who need them most. Your contributions will help create a meaningful social and economic impact in the agricultural ecosystem. We invite passionate and skilled individuals to join us in this transformative journey. Together, let’s empower communities and drive sustainable change.
   

  

**Volunteer Logistics**
 Estimated hours required per week: 10
   

  

 The estimated duration of the project is: 3-6 months
   

  

 This position is Virtual (Remote)
   

  

**Language Requirements**
 English
   

  

**Desired Skills And Experience**
 Core Design Skills:
   

  

* Strong understanding of user interface design principles, including layout, typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.
* Proficiency in creating responsive designs that work across different devices and screen sizes
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) and inclusive design practices Experience with design systems and component libraries UX


**Research & Strategy**
* Ability to conduct user research, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing
* Experience creating user personas, journey maps, and information architecture
* Understanding of user psychology and behavior patterns
* Data analysis skills to make informed design decisions


**Technical Skills**
* Proficiency in industry-standard design tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD Knowledge of prototyping tools (e.g., Principle, ProtoPie, InVision)
* Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and web/mobile design constraints
* Familiarity with version control and design handoff tools


**Process & Collaboration**
* Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking
* Experience with agile development processes
* Excellent communication skills to work with developers, product managers, and stakeholders
* Portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design process and problem-solving approach


**Additional Valuable Skills**
* Understanding of front-end development principles
* Experience with animation and micro-interactions
* Knowledge of A/B testing and optimization techniques
* Business acumen to align design decisions with company goals

title: Project Manager
description:
**About The Job**
 We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), adtech and martech. We are part of Merkle worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.
   

  

 We are a global agency, so your role will be to have a broad, diverse set of responsibilities within a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
   

  

 As a project Manager, you will oversee, plan and lead client projects to ensure qualitative deliveries. You will focus on client needs, strengthening these relationships and ensuring that we exceed expectations in every aspect. You will foster smooth collaboration between clients and our team of strategists and specialists across various domains, including customer experience strategy, UX/UI design, A/B testing, data analysis, CRM, technical implementation, web development and change management.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Day-to-day client and team communication and management ensuring work progresses according to plan and ensuring client satisfaction.
* Manage project status and finances by updating reports and ensuring projects stay on budget.
* Scoping and planning of new projects
* Team resourcing


**Qualifications**
* You have 3+ years of experience in similar positions from an agency/consulting company.
* You understand the fundamental principles of customer experience.
* You are client-focused and understand client needs.
* Strong understanding of agile methodologies and their application in project management.
* You possess a strong strategic mindset.
* You have strong professional, organizational, and administrative skills, demonstrating proactivity to manage daily challenges.
* You find it exciting to be part of a client team, you manage to bring out the best in others and know when to delegate responsibility and when to take charge yourself.
* You have a good understanding and communication skills in both Swedish and English since both languages will be used in the workplace.


**About Dentsu Sweden**
 Dentsu Sweden is part of a global communications network with 72,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting clients. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to Svensk Miljöbas, and we actively work with our social and environmental responsibilities as employers and fellow human beings. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion are deeply rooted in our shared values - the 8 Ways to Never Before - and our Leadership Framework is applicable to all our employees. We are proud of what makes us unique as a company and individuals, and we encourage applicants from all different types of backgrounds to apply to us.
   

  

**We Offer, Among Other Things**
* Collective agreement
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days of vacation
* Flexibility and the best possible mix of two good things, working at our offices and working from home
* Many career and development opportunities


**Application and contact**
 Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 The position is full-time with permanent employment and is located at our Stockholm or Gothenburg office. There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a fast process. The job ad will be removed after filling the position.
   

  

**For Questions, Contact**
 Maria K. Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com.

title: E-commerce & Growth Expert
company_industry: Retail and Personal Care Product Manufacturing
description:
**We’re seeking an entrepreneurial E-commerce & Growth Expert to lead Melyon’s growth. With a strong foundation in place, now’s the time to scale. If you’re eager to join a fast-growing beauty brand in an early stage and shape its global journey, this is your chance.** 




  





 Melyon (www.melyon.co) is a Swedish skincare brand founded in 2020, blending Scandinavian design with West African heritage. Our ethical, high-performance products cater to all skin types, with a special focus on darker skin tones.
 



  





 In the early years of Melyon, we worked tirelessly on product development, branding, and logistics to create a solid foundation. Now, with everything in place, it's time to scale. As we aim to grow from €0,1 to €5M in revenue in the upcoming years, we’re looking for an
 **entrepreneurial** 
**E-commerce & Growth Expert** 
 to be our third team member, working closely with our co-founders, Roger and Raouf, to take Melyon to the next level.
 



  





**Your Role** 




 As
 **E-commerce & Growth Manager** 
 , you’ll be the driving force behind Melyon’s digital growth. You’ll manage our
 **Shopify** 
 platform, optimize the customer journey, and lead performance marketing initiatives.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Own and optimize the Shopify platform to deliver a seamless, premium shopping experience.
* Develop and execute e-commerce growth strategies.
* Track and improve key metrics (conversion rates, AOV, traffic) to drive revenue.
* Collaborate with marketing and content teams to align e-commerce initiatives.
* Lead paid media efforts (PPC, SEO, SEM) to maximize ROAS and growth.
* Drive customer acquisition and retention across the sales funnel.
* Manage relationships with key vendors to streamline operations.
* Define and track KPIs to ensure data-driven growth.



  





**Who You Are** 




 You’re an experienced e-commerce expert ready to
 **join a company in the startup stage** 
 , understanding both the challenges and immense opportunities that come with it. You’re not here for the comfort of a stable monthly salary — you’re here because you want to be part of building something extraordinary.
 



  





 You thrive in dynamic environments where things move fast, and you’re comfortable wearing many hats to get things done. You understand that startup life means building as you go, and you’re ready to dive into that challenge with full commitment.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 3+ years of experience scaling e-commerce startups, driving revenue from €0 to €5M+.
* Expertise in
 **Shopify** 
 , D2C platforms, and
 **social media** 
 (both paid and organic).
* CRM experience (preferably Klaviyo) and strong paid media skills (Meta, TikTok, Google).
* Knowledge of SEO, SEM, UX principles, and analytics (Google Analytics 4).
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Why Join Melyon?** 



* Be part of the early days of a D2C brand with
 **global recognition** 
 (featured in Vogue, Elle, Bazaar, Financial Times, and more) and an
 **international approach** 
 from day one.
* Join a
 **brand primed for growth** 
 , with its story, products, and infrastructure ready to scale.
* Work closely with founders who have experience building global success.
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your impact will be felt immediately.
* Opportunity to become a
 **partner** 
 if it’s a great match.



  





 Initially, the compensation will be a mix on monthly salary + a generous bonus package.
 



  





**Ready to take Melyon to the next level?** 




 If you’re an ambitious e-commerce expert passionate about scaling D2C brands, we’d love to hear from you!

title: SPP Sandbox - Summer Internship 2025
description:
*Gjort planer för sommaren? Vill du vara med och skapa en framtid att glädjas åt?*
**SPP Sandbox** 
 är ett tvärfunktionellt internship, där studenter med olika studiebakgrunder ska lösa en verklig utmaning som SPP och våra kunder står inför. Här får du möjlighet att få erfarenhet från en av världens viktigaste branscher.
   

  

 Tillsammans med teamet får ni möjlighet att veckovis presentera era framsteg och samarbeta med ett antal nyckelpersoner hos SPP och Storebrandkoncernen.
   

  

 För att trivas som deltagare i SPP Sandbox tror vi att du är lösningsorienterad, har ett starkt engagemang och ett kommersiellt tänk. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och dessutom är nyfiken på teknik tror vi att du får en rolig och lärorik sommar på SPP!
   

  

 Programmet är från vecka
 **24-33** 
 med semester under vecka 28-31.
   

  

**Vad är speciellt hos oss?**
 Det som skiljer SPP Sandbox från många andra internship är att du får jobba med personer från olika studiebakgrunder och att ni tillsammans tar fullt ägandeskap för ett case och driver processen framåt mot en lösning. SPP är tjänstepensionsbolaget som alltid vill gå steget längre och vi brinner för att göra tjänstepension enkelt. Och i skärningspunkten av detta jobbar vi med att tänka nytt och kreativt för hur vi kan hjälpa folk att förverkliga sina pensionsdrömmar.
   

  

**Vem letar vi efter?** 
  

  

 Vi letar efter nytänkande studenter som är engagerade i frågor som hållbarhet, försäkring/finans, innovation och teknologi. Vi söker efter drivna studenter från olika studiebakgrunder och universitet.
   

  

 Studerar du datateknik, ekonomi, entreprenörskap, hållbarhet, design/UX eller projektledning? Eller kanske något helt annat? Det viktigaste är att du är innovativt driven, oavsett studieområde. Du är idag på ditt första år på mastern eller sista år på bachelorn, med
 **tidigast** 
 planerad examen januari 2026. Du har goda akademiska resultat och har med fördel engagerat dig utanför studierna med relevant deltidsjobb eller inom universitetet.
   

  

**Är du sommarens Sandboxare?** 
  

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! I din ansökan laddar du upp ditt CV och betyg/examensbevis, så vi får möjlighet att göra en så rättvis bedömning av dig som kandidat. Du behöver inte skicka med något personligt brev, utan kommer i stället få svara på några ansökningsfrågor.
   

  

*Har du frågor om SPP Sandbox kan du ta kontakt med:* 

 Rekryteringsansvarig:
   

  

 Lovisa Stehn, lovisa.stehn@spp.se
   

  

 Programansvarig:
   

  

 Daniel Åhlfeldt, Chief Product Owner, daniel.ahlfeldt@spp.se
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag är 26 januari 2025.** 
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Läs mer om SPP Sandbox och rekryteringsprocessen ➡️
 **här**
  

  

**Är du fortfarande inte säker på om du ska söka till SPP Sandbox 2025? Här är en sista hisspitch till dig** 
**📢**
 SPP är en del av den nordiska finanskoncernen Storebrand. Tillsammans skapar vi en framtid att glädjas åt genom att vägleda till ekonomiska beslut som gynnar individen, samhället, planeten och inte minst våra egna medarbetare. Allt annat vore kortsiktigt. Som deltagare i SPP Sandbox får du möjlighet att lära känna Storebrand som finanskoncern, och lära dig lite om hur många olika uppgifter vi arbetar med varje dag och om hur vi skapar värde för våra kunder och samhället. En unik arena för lärande och en god investering för din framtid!
   

  

*SPP är
 *som en del av den finansiella sektorn mån om att våra medarbetare har hög personlig integritet och ett etiskt förhållningssätt.**
*Som en följd av detta genomförs, med kandidatens samtycke, en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessen slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Salesforce Project Manager
job_function: Consulting, Information Technology, and Project Management
company_industry: Information Services and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**ABOUT NEXTVIEW CONSULTING** 




 Nextview is a design-led Salesforce consulting firm that fuels and accelerates the digital transformation of ambitious companies throughout Europe. As a Nextview team member, you are a designer of better business. You will be an accelerator of positive change with a huge impact on our clients, our company and the planet as a whole. Are you ready to put your energy to work at this B-corporation and Great Place to Work? Then join the adventure!
 



  





 We are friendly and enthusiastic team passionate about the way we support our clients to grow their business, enabling them to become more customer-centric and optimized. We challenge brands with a vision for the future to reinvent their way of working. We stimulate customer focus and digitisation of operations, and we bring data to life. To realise this, we combine our in-depth knowledge of the industry with Salesforce expertise and apply it to the concept of design thinking. We guide the digital transformation so that organisations can improve more and more every day.
 



  





**ABOUT THE JOB** 




 In the fast-paced world of digital transformation, our role is to empower our clients with solutions that revolutionise their operations, customer engagement, and market positioning. The need for Project Managers who can lead teams to success has never been greater. At Nextview, you'll play a pivotal role in aligning our clients strategic goals with the outcomes of the individual project(s). You will be leading these projects in order to drive organisational change at our clients organisation, envisioning their future customer experience and internal organisation and ensuring the implementation of the supporting Salesforce capabilities.
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING** 




 Overseeing and managing the entire process from quotation (associated assumptions, project approach, risk, team setup of a multidisciplinary team, planning and budget) to the realisation of the project goal(s) at our client.
 



  





 Creating new opportunities for Nextview during the client lifecycle and collaborate closely with Sales colleagues and the Salesforce AE on the strategy in the client account plan.
 



  





 Leading the project or continuous development cycle by:
 


* Managing the full lifecycle of client engagements on time and within budget through effective project governance, clear written and verbal communication, and managing client expectations.
* Collaborating with internal and client team members and stakeholders throughout the entire engagement lifecycle spanning, technology agnostic discovery activities, design of customer and employee journeys, creation of PSA, roadmapping, Salesforce configuration, build, testing, deployment, post-go-live support and adoption activities.
* Building, managing, supporting & motivating the multi-disciplinary team, consisting of developers, Salesforce consultants, service and UX/UI designers, business consultants and architects.
* Build a cooperative network environment where the Nextview team and the client team combined are able to collaborate and communicate open and effectively.
* Having a strong focus on delivering valuable outcome, ensuring quality of the deliverables, while monitoring the progress, budget and planning.
* You’re able to identify (potential) project risks (i.e. valuable outcome, specs, costs, planning, etc) and able to develop risk mitigations, define corrective actions and drive projects to succesfull delivery. In case of bottlenecks; you’re able to proactively intervene.
* leading our projects according to our Design-Led Approach; strongly based on design thinking and agile principles, from discovery, via implementation and go-lives towards successful adoption of organisational changes supported by the Salesforce capabilities.
* Excellent communication towards our client, stakeholders and the project team. Multi-level stakeholder management, incl stakeholders from our client, partners and our internal organisation.
* Gathering and reporting project performance and progress information (e.g. outcome, quality, status, time, money, etc) to senior management, project team and our clients management.
* Ensuring proper documentation and effective transfer of project results and associated knowledge.



 Being a trusted advisor for our clients on a strategic level, in a billable manner.
 



 Deploying our own project approach improvements, supporting a culture of continuous improvement.
 



  





**ABOUT YOU** 



* You have 5+ experience in project management and/or strategy and management consulting, in the context of innovation and digital transformation, particularly in delivering Salesforce, CRM implementations or SaaS transformations.
* You’re passionate about how technology can enable business processes to achieve their objectives, design, innovation and strategy.
* Possess a comprehensive understanding of Digital projects, IT architecture and software development lifecycle.
* You are familiar with Agile project management, Agile and Scrum principles and project management tools like Jira.
* Being familiar with design or design thinking is a pro.
* Strong entrepreneurial mindset.
* Preferably holding PMP or equivalent project management certification.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of building robust relationships with clients and internal teams and multi level stakeholder management.
* Strong communication skills in
 **Swedish and English (is a must).**
* Willingness and commitment to continuous learning (e.g. Salesforce certifications).



  





**NEXTVIEW BENEFITS** 




 With a distinctive, design thinking-oriented approach and FD Gazelle winner for seven years in a row, Nextview is a leading consultancy that supports national and international companies in their digital transformation in more than sixty countries.
 



  





 Working at Nextview means working in an innovative, fast-paced, and diverse environment. With lots of opportunities to develop yourself and drive digital transformation with our valued customers. Check out our values, guiding principles, and culture combined with our unique working formula. We’ll grab every opportunity to celebrate memorable moments. Nextview has been awarded as a Great Place to Work 8 times in a row. We are a certified B Corp; a community of leaders, driving a global movement of people using business as a force for good. Our purpose to create a positive impact is not just a nice and caring story. Companies that ignore the demand for positive change in society, will be the dinosaurs of our time. Helping organisations excel responsibly by simply delivering excellence serves our purpose to create a better world. So let’s build ecosystems where people, planet and profit come together!
 



  





 At Nextview, we understand that our team is our greatest asset, and we're committed to providing a comprehensive benefits package tailored to the needs and regulations of each country we operate in. While the core of our offerings is consistent across locations, here’s a glimpse of country-specific benefits that await you: performance bonuses, flexible holiday plan, individual mobility budget, phone and fitness allowances, Apple Macbook, €2500 annual education budget, and more.
 



  





***We are seeking qualified candidates to join our team for a full-time position. Please note that, due to legal and operational constraints, we can only consider applicants who possess valid and relevant work permits that allow full-time employment in Sweden. This requirement is essential for the successful execution of the role and compliance with local regulations. We appreciate your understanding and compliance with this prerequisite.***




  





**WE ARE DIVERSITY** 




 At Nextview, we see and live the added value of diversity. We focus on talent and personality, regardless of your age, religion, gender, cultural or ethnic background, and physical or mental abilities. Whoever you are: you are more than welcome to apply for this position.
 



  





**RAISE THE BAR** 




 Nextview started in 2009 as a consulting firm, helping companies implement user-friendly and innovative IT solutions. In the last decade we have been growing fast, transforming ourselves on the go. This has not gone unnoticed, as we’ve been recognised with several awards throughout the years. By 2020 we were prepared for the next step. From a strong home base in the Netherlands, we first expanded to Germany, then to Czech Republic, Poland and Sweden.

title: Principal Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **Bangkok-based** 
**, Relocation Provided.** 
 Principal Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Principal Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. You can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you’ll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Product Leaders for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* 7+ years of Product Management experience
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction to different stakeholders
* Experience developing and launching products
* Experience leading global product vision, go-to-market strategy and design discussions
* Entrepreneurial and analytical skills; effective at breaking down complex problems and driving and managing change
* Hands-on mentality


**It’s great if you have:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics
* Data tools – SQL, Python, R, or equivalent


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior full stack engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Software Development
description:
I'm working with one of Sweden's most innovative startups, a renowned company who are pioneering the online retail space, with cutting-edge technology and AI, and empowering e-commerce brands to optimize their platform and operations to be able to compete with global retailers worldwide!
 



  





 With a hyper-intelligent merchandising application and Shopify platform, are a 'co-pilot' for online brands worldwide, enabling them to create incredibly user-centric platforms and enhance their operations through the use of AI, LLMs, NLPs, which ultimately has a direct impact on the user experience of millions of shoppers globally!
 



  





 With plenty of new developments in the pipeline, and plans to continuously evolve and modernize their existing platform, they are looking to bring in a senior fullstack software engineer, with a slight focus on frontend, to join the team on a permanent basis!
 



  





 This is a hybrid role - based out of Stockholm, but with great remote flexibility too.
 



  





 How you will make an impact
 



  




* Developing a visual merchandising tool that online retailers love to work with, helping them create the most user-friendly platforms.
* Improve the user experience for millions of users by building and deploying high-quality shopping UX
* Enable smooth integrations and onboarding of customers using e-commerce platforms



  





 What do we look for?
 



  




* Deep knowledge about TypeScript, React, CSS, and HTML and care about writing high-quality code
* Experience with GCP is beneficial, that's our cloud platform
* Experience in working with large single-page applications demanding delightful UI/UX, pixel perfection, and well-thought-through API/Backend
* Open to learn Python - but solid experience within backend development will be a huge advantage!



  





 Some of the benefits!
 



  




* being part of a super talented, small team, we've worked incredibly hard to foster a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration, where everyone is on the same page and has a voice!
* 4000 SEK in annual wellness allowance
* 30 paid vacation days
* Work from our office in Stockholm predominantly, or remote (within a 2 hour of CET time zone)
* Monthly co-working allowance
* Annual learning allowance
* Company Laptop
* Fun Quarterly off-sites



  





 This is a permanent employment. We will unfortunately not be considering candidates who require visa sponsorships currently.

title: Android Developer
description:
Tradera is a purpose-driven company with a belief that consumption has a significant impact on our planet. We are determined to use what we can control - our business, our voice, our creativity, and our platform - to take action.
   

  

 At Tradera, we are on a mission to "Drive the Transition to Sustainable Shopping" by changing the way people consume and resell preloved goods. Our technical platform is an enabler in facilitating this shift. Together, we are building large, distributed, and scalable systems capable of handling vast amounts of data. With more than five million weekly visits and 300 bids per second during peak traffic, our technical solutions face significant demands.
   

  

 To continue our mission, we need more people to join us!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are currently seeking a Android Developer to join our app team at Tradera. In this role, you will collaborate with dedicated developers who are responsible for crafting our Android app, serving thousands of users across the Nordic region.
   

  

 Your work will involve seamless coordination with our tech, product management, and UX teams to propel the next generation of our user-facing applications.
   

  

 Additionally, we take pride in fostering a friendly learning culture, where we actively encourage continuous growth and development among our team members.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Build a cutting edge Android app and write readable object-oriented Kotlin.
* Collaborate with a small autonomous team of developers, designer, and product owner to find end-to-end solutions to important problems.
* Become a valued member of an autonomous and cross-functional team.
* Share knowledge and help the team evolve best practices.
* You will work with languages and technologies such as: Kotlin, Android SDK, Realm, Jetpack Compose, GitLab, release management in Google Play.


**Who you are** 
 ?
   

  

* You have at least 1+ years of professional Android experience
* You are driven, innovative and flexible in your way of working.
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code.
* You enjoy a fast paced, collaborative & agile environment and prefer to create great products together with your team.
* Product mindset and care about user experience.


 At Tradera we offer competitive salaries and benefits like a yearly bonus and a generous pot for competence development. But most of all, you’ll get a little extra when you join us! Like a group of talented people who really love what we do and with strong belief that people deserve a smooth way to care about the planet!
   

  

 Come and join us – Don’t be square, get circular!

title: SAP Technology consultant to Accenture’s Nordic Technology practice
description:
***SAP***
***Technology***
***consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group***
 Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Technology consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and we are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, go to https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP technology by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP technology Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP** 
**technology** 
**Nordic Value Tower**
 SAP technology Value Tower is one out of 10 different subsections in the Nordic SAP Business Group and you can easily state that Technology is the heart of any SAP solution. In the SAP Technology Value Tower we are working many different technologies that is bringing the SAP solutions into well managed and integrated platforms. This covers latest Cloud strategies including Hyperscaler setup, various Integration technologies, Infrastructure and platform, Security, UX and Basis.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
- Min. 2+ years of hands-on SAP experience in an onshore project role (preferably in the Nordics)

- Hands-on eexperience with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) development and Integration Suite

- Strong resonance with Accenture values Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

- We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to see having at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as having led a team, and ideally also some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects.

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience in at least one S/4HANA, SuccessFactors or Ariba implementation, or related Analytics project work

- Experience with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) development and Integration Suite

- Hands on experience with SAP Basis activities, SAP release upgrades, and infrastructure updates for cloud customers

- Exposure to SAP Basis, SAP S/4HANA, Azure/ AWS (in context of SAP Greenfield and Brownfield Customers)

- Good understanding of ECSs operations infrastructure, processes, and automation tools like SPC, TIC, etc. is a plus

- Experience in SAP FIORI, SAP UI5

- Basic understanding of SAP HANA DB

- Experience with SAP Integration technologies (SAP Cloud Integration) connecting SAP & non-SAP solutions is a plus

- General Solution Manager config experience is a plus

- Azure, AWS or GCP experience is a plus

- An SAP certification in relevant area

- Deep business and industry experience in one or more industries

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, or Finnish) language spoken

title: Back End-utvecklare
description:
**Vi söker en nyfiken, passionerad och driven mjukvaruutvecklare! 🚀** 




  





 Vill du vara med och utveckla produkter för framtiden på ett företag som är på väg att bli ett gasellföretag 2025? Hos oss på
 **LS Elektronik** 
 , som sedan 2023 ingår i
 **Northcom-koncernen** 
 , får du chansen att kombinera teknik, design och affärsstrategi i en dynamisk roll som bidrar till att forma framtidens radiokommunikation. Vår produktportfölj,
 **Mimer SoftRadio** 
 , står i centrum för vår vision att leverera robusta och innovativa lösningar för en global marknad.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som mjukvaruutvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt produkt- och utvecklingsteam, lett av vår Head of Product. Du arbetar med allt från tekniska lösningar till att förbättra användarupplevelse (UX) och kundupplevelse (CX). Med stöd av vår roadmap i Notion och ett nära samarbete via Microsoft 365, bygger vi innovativa produkter som möter marknadens höga krav.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:** 



* **Utveckling & design:** 
 Skapa nya funktionsmoduler och designa native Windows-applikationer i C++/C# med fokus på användarvänlighet och prestanda.
* **Modernisering & optimering:** 
 Konvertera och förbättra befintlig Delphi-kod, samt integrera nya funktioner i C++.
* **UX & CX:** 
 Bidra till att skapa produkter som sätter användaren i centrum och levererar enastående upplevelser.
* **Produktutveckling:** 
 Arbeta med produktförbättringar baserat på vår roadmap tillsammans med produktteamet.
* **Nätverk & kommunikation:** 
 Implementera robusta lösningar för dataöverföring med fokus på nätverksprotokoll och effektivitet.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* **Utbildning:** 
 En relevant högskoleexamen inom mjukvaruutveckling, datateknik eller liknande.
* **Erfarenhet:** 
 Några års erfarenhet av att utveckla Windows-applikationer i C++/C#.
* **Teknisk förståelse:** 
 Kunskap om nätverksprotokoll (t.ex. TCP/IP) och realtidsdataöverföring.
* **Samarbetsvilja:** 
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och använda digitala verktyg som Microsoft 365 och Notion.
* **Personligt driv,** 
 engagemang, prestigelös och vill vara en del av ett högpresterande team.



  





**Plus i kanten om du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Java, .NET eller annat Backend språk.
* Routing, lastbalansering och analys av nätverkstrafik.
* Verktyg och protokoll som DNS, BGP och ARP.



  





**Det här erbjuder vi:** 



* Marknadsmässig lön, pension och friskvårdsbidrag.
* Nya, inspirerande lokaler som främjar både kreativitet och produktivitet.
* En roll i ett snabbväxande företag med ambitionen att bli ett gasellföretag.
* Möjlighet att kombinera teknik, design och affärsförståelse.
* En arbetsplats som värdesätter innovation, samarbete och personlig utveckling.



  





**Rekryteringsprocessen:** 



1. **Intervjuer:** 
 Lär känna oss och visa vad du kan bidra med.
2. **Case:** 
 Ett kortare case/kodtest för att visa din problemlösningsförmåga och tekniska kompetens.
3. **Referenstagning:** 
 Vi hör av oss till personer som kan intyga dina styrkor.



  





**Placering & startdatum:** 




 📍
 **Placering:** 
 Stockholm (Kista)
 



 🕒
 **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



 🚦
 **Startdatum:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Bifoga ditt CV och portfolio i nästa steg . Ansökningar kommer att granskas löpande.
 



 Har du några frågor är du välkommen att höra av dig till Head Of Product: mustafa.marouf@lse.se
 



  





**Om oss** 




**LS Elektronik** 
 , en del av
 **Northcom-koncernen**
